channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi Jake,

Is this issue related to https://travis-ci.org/apache/thrift/builds/29241293#L3963 ?

cp: cannot stat `./thrifty.hh': No such file or directory
make[2]: *** [distdir] Error 1

I've tried to fix it but I can't work out what is happening there neither reproduce it in any of my machines...

Cheers,
Henrique

Hey Henrique, thrifty.hh is a generated file, see compiler/cpp/Makefile.am am__yacc_c2h, i've seen that issue and was going to take a look at it after getting the basics back in order, this ticket is for files that have been added since the last release that are needing to be added to EXTRA_DIST

Adding macro check around bison version and removing am__yacc_c2h and will conditionally include the necessary h/hh file, this will fix the mentioned missing .hh file in dist and make it compatible with automake 1.11 and above, also fixed issue with d library attempting to run tests in parallel in newer versions of automake as reported in THRIFT-2294

105 files in total that have been added/renamed since 0.9.1 that are missing from the dist

/thrift/bower.json
/thrift/compiler/cpp/CMakeLists.txt
/thrift/compiler/cpp/src/logging.h

8fd8c63 adds all listed files to the dist package
ef7d56c updated ruby ext to use RBConfig for newer version of ruby
4f54d13 removed am__yacc_c2h and added bison macro to check automake version and include correct header

FAILURE: Integrated in Thrift #1213 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Thrift/1213/)
Thrift-2602:Fix missing dist files (jfarrell: rev 4c8506e30d2eee616ea62b79fc6c3e523a03f294)

  • tutorial/Makefile.am
  • lib/php/test/Makefile.am
Can this be checked automatically?

I have this issue with this.

configure: creating ./config.status
config.status: error: cannot find input file: `Makefile.in'

on Debian stable using
autoconf 2.69-1
automake 1:1.11.6-1

and had to do this first:

diff --git a/configure.ac b/configure.ac
index 49d704e..efb328f 100755
--- a/configure.ac
+++ b/configure.ac
@@ -88,7 +88,7 @@ AC_PROG_CXX
 AC_PROG_INSTALL
 AC_PROG_LIBTOOL
 AC_PROG_MAKE_SET
-AC_PROG_BISON
+AC_PROG_BISON(2.5)
 AC_PROG_YACC
 AC_PROG_LEX
 AM_PROG_LEX

analysis in progress...
I had put AC_PROG_BISON defaulted to 2.6 in aclocal/ac_prog_bison.m4

commit 30a472e04f26312f93cee0faaaa80a99bb3ed776

Added check for php extension to not build if phpize has not been run,
update Vagrantfile to update package list for haskell test deps, and
change bison min version to 2.4 to work with the current versions of
debian, ubuntu and centos.

FAILURE: Integrated in Thrift #1214 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Thrift/1214/)
THRIFT-2602: Fix missing dist files (jfarrell: rev 30a472e04f26312f93cee0faaaa80a99bb3ed776)

  • aclocal/ac_prog_bison.m4
  • lib/php/Makefile.am
  • contrib/Vagrantfile
  • configure.ac
  • .gitignore
as mention on ML, issues with Debian stable

it works with this patch

  • set bison to 2.5
  • use .NOTPARALLEL instead of AUTOMAKE_OPTIONS
  • #include "config.h" within thriftl.ll

;-r

After updating M4 and Bison on my MinGW it works for me too.

Slight issue: The bison test tests for 2.5, but complains about "2.4 or higher must be installed". Not a big problem, since the status message immediately before that line clearly indicates 2.5 is needed.

.NOTPARALLEL does not work for me for the lib/d test using bison 3.0.2. Tested using the contrib/Vagrantfile which is ubuntu 14.04

Makefile:785: *** unterminated variable reference. Stop.

just committed

  • set bison to 2.5
  • #include "config.h" within thriftl.ll

I have a look at the use .NOTPARALLEL instead of AUTOMAKE_OPTIONS thing now.
-roger

FAILURE: Integrated in Thrift #1219 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Thrift/1219/)
THRIFT-2602 Fix missing dist files (roger: rev 3974aaba691cfc3681b71667ddd5c65a3d7e74ac)

  • configure.ac
  • compiler/cpp/src/thriftl.ll

I did a manual update of automake to 1.14.1-3 and it works!
...and we got new issues, but only warnings

I'm ok with this for the moment.
+1 for a next rc

Upgrading above 1.11 fixes the issue with serial-tests since it was added in 1.12 but this does not fix the issue in 1.11 of the lib/d makefiles using the AUTOMAKE_OPTIONS. We can do one of the following

a. Change the default automake version to 1.12
b. Look at adding a macro to add 'serial-tests' flag to the automake options
c. Disable lib/d if automake is 1.11

roger.meier, jensg Thoughts?

I personally can live with 1.12, iff it works.
roger.meier, did you try with 1.12?
Could it be that PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG should actually be PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG()? I start getting strange erorrs here which disappeared after I added the parentheses.

I have one more. The build slaves are failing with the following error right now. Simply removing all switches after --disable-libs from the script solved this for me.

checking whether the C compiler works... no
configure: error: in `<https://builds.apache.org/job/Thrift-Compiler-Windows/ws/'>:
configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
See `config.log' for more details
jfarrell, the patch works for me using automake 1.12, given the additional changes above.
